Generative function interface¶

The generative function interface is a set of methods defined for generative functions which support the implementation of programmable inference algorithms.

Combined with the trace and choice map datatypes, these interface methods are the conceptual core of generative functions.

This module exposes the generative function interface as a set of generic Python functions. When called with f: GenerativeFunction and **kwargs, they return the corresponding GenerativeFunction method.

genjax.interface.simulate(f, **kwargs)[source]¶

simulate accepts a function f and returns a transformed function which implements the below semantics.

Given key: PRNGKey and args: Tuple, sample \(t\sim p(\cdot;x)\) and \(r\sim p(\cdot;args, t)\) and apply the return value function \(ret = f(args, t)\).

Compute the score of the sample \(t\) under \(p(\cdot; x)\).

Return the return value \(ret\), the sample \(t\), and the score in a Trace instance, along with an evolved PRNGKey.

Parameters:

  • key (jax.random.PRNGKey) – A JAX-compatible PRNGKey.

  • args (tuple) – A tuple of argument values.

Returns:

  • key (PRNGKey) – An updated jax.random.PRNGKey.

  • tr (genjax.Trace) – A representation of the recorded random choices, as well as inference metadata, accrued during the call.

Example

import jax
import genjax

@genjax.gen
def model(key):
    key, x = genjax.trace("x", genjax.Normal)(key, (0.0, 1.0))
    return key, x

key = jax.random.PRNGKey(314159)
key, tr = genjax.simulate(model)(key, ())
print(tr)

JAXTrace(
  gen_fn=<function model>,
  args=(),
  retval=(f32[],),
  choices=Trie(
    nodes={
      'x':
      DistributionTrace(
        gen_fn=_Normal(),
        args=(0.0, 1.0),
        value=f32[],
        score=f32[]
      )
    }
  ),
  score=f32[]
)
